decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly put powerful creatures onto the battlefield by cheating them in using the "Show and Tell" card. The key strategy is to use cards like Sneak Attack, Lotus Petal, and Simian Spirit Guide to get cards like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play without paying their high mana costs. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo and card selection spells like Brainstorm, Preordain, and Ponder to help find the necessary pieces.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm opponents with big threats. By utilizing lands like Eldrazi Temple and Cloudpost, along with artifacts like Grim Monolith and Chalice of the Void, this deck can ramp up to play massive creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Reality Smasher ahead of schedule. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Trinisphere and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and close out the game quickly with overwhelming Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play quickly, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Meddling Mage and Remorseful Cleric. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Plague Engineer, while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like True-Name Nemesis. The deck also has some flicker effects with cards like Soulherder and Flickerwisp to gain additional value from creatures with enter the battlefield abilities. The strategy is to out-tempo and out-value the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler to dominate the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful draw spells like Ponder and Accumulated Knowledge to maintain card advantage. Its win condition is often through Entreat the Angels or locking down the opponent with cards like Terminus and Back to Basics. With a mix of control elements and versatile threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a long game.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Gurmag Angler, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive spells such as Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The deck also includes powerful planeswalker Oko, Thief of Crowns to further control the battlefield. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes disruptive lands like Wasteland. The goal is to apply pressure early and maintain control of the game through disruption, ultimately overwhelming the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and creatures through Elves to ramp up to powerful finishers like Craterhoof Behemoth and Archon of Valor's Reach. It leverages cards like Glimpse of Nature and Heritage Druid to fuel explosive turns and search for combo pieces with Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order. The synergy between creatures like Nettle Sentinel, Quirion Ranger, and Wirewood Symbiote allows for multiple activations and untaps, ensuring a steady stream of mana and card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a lethal board state or lock them out with Archon of Valor's Reach.

The main focus of this Bant Control Legacy deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, card selection, and powerful planeswalker threats. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Spell Pierce to disrupt opponent's strategies, along with efficient removal in Swords to Plowshares and Supreme Verdict, this deck aims to control the pace of the game. With powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, this deck can maintain board presence and generate card advantage to outvalue opponents.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Drown in the Loch while controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. The deck also aims to generate value with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Oko, Thief of Crowns. Additionally, cards like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Plague Engineer serve to hinder the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes efficient creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Snapcaster Mage to apply pressure and draw cards.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources using cards like Wasteland and Chalice of the Void, while also utilizing the graveyard with Life from the Loam and Sevinne's Reclamation. It aims to grind out value with cards like Punishing Fire and Liliana of the Veil, while also deploying threats like Knight of the Reliquary and Tarmogoyf. The deck has a versatile mana base with access to multiple colors and utility lands like Karakas and Maze of Ith. Overall, it combines control elements with graveyard synergies to outvalue the opponent in a long game.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to utilize cheap and efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Thoughtseize, and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, Gurmag Angler, Young Pyromancer, and Brazen Borrower to pressure the opponent. The deck also includes permission spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its threats and maintain its aggressive tempo. Additionally, the deck incorporates mana denial with cards like Wasteland to keep the opponent off balance and prevent them from stabilizing.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker, while also applying pressure with creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Flickerwisp. It uses Aether Vial and Recruiter of the Guard to efficiently bring out key creatures, and equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to enhance their abilities. The deck also includes interaction spells like Swords to Plowshares for removal. Overall, it aims to control the board and outvalue opponents in order to win through consistent aggression and disruption.

The main focus of this deck is to use the infect mechanic to win the game quickly by dealing poison counters to the opponent. It utilizes powerful pump spells like Berserk and Become Immense to increase the power of its infect creatures, such as Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent. The deck also includes various disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces and ensure a quick victory. Additionally, there are card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to help find the necessary pieces for the combo.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token, which can win the game in just one attack. The deck includes various ways to search for these combo pieces, protect them from removal spells, and disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck also has some utility creatures like Elvish Reclaimer and Dark Confidant to provide additional value and card advantage.

The main idea of this Grixis Aggro deck is to deploy efficient threats early in the game and disrupt the opponent's game plan with countermagic and hand disruption. By combining aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist with versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to apply pressure while keeping the opponent on the back foot. By utilizing tempo plays such as Wasteland and Daze to disrupt the opponent's mana base, the deck looks to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of disruptive spells like Force of Will, Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Abrupt Decay to control the game while gradually building up a board presence with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf, Baleful Strix, and Oko, Thief of Crowns. This creates a balance between disruption and aggression, allowing the deck to adapt to different types of matchups and strategies. The addition of card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor further solidifies the deck's ability to outvalue opponents in longer games.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures. By consistently casting low-cost burn spells and attacking with Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel, the deck aims to reduce the opponent's life total as fast as possible. Cards like Price of Progress and Sulfuric Vortex provide additional sources of damage to ensure a swift victory.
